original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.73. Sanidassanattika, Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānadukādi🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna duka ādi  anidassana appaṭigham citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā cha ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: The forward and reverse order of conditions in relation to mental factors, the triplets, and the Paṭṭhāna text🔽The section on the dyads beginning with the produced by the visible and the contacted🔽With respect to the clause “With an object that is not visible and is not resistant, there arises what is not visible and is not resistant, that is not associated with consciousness and is derived from the primary elements that are the basis of the mind faculty,” there is:🔽With respect to the clause “With an object that is not visible and is not resistant, there arises what is not visible and is not resistant, that is associated with consciousness and is derived from the primary elements that are the basis of the mind faculty,” there is:

original: Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhū dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: anidassana appaṭigham citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhum dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhū dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta 🔽hetuyā cha ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: With respect to the clause “With an object that is not visible and is not resistant, there arises what is not visible and is not resistant, that is not associated with consciousness and is derived from the primary elements that are the basis of the mind faculty,” there is:

original: Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: anidassana appaṭigham citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattim dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ no citta sa saṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattī dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: Dependent on a non-evident, non-inhibitory, mind-contact-originated, change-of-lineage idea, there arises a non-evident, non-inhibitory, not mind-contact-originated, not change-of-lineage idea, as root-cause condition. …

original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: In the case of the six kinds of root-cause condition, there are six. In the case of the three kinds of object condition, there are three. … In the case of the six kinds of non-hindrance condition, there are six.
